page.title: 16Miners in Cliffe
page.content: There are not yet many miners living in Cliffe, although the Selby Coalfield is being developed. One of the mine shafts is at Whitemoor in the north of Cliffe Parish, but outside the area covered by this survey. The Selby District Council has a plan for some land in Cliffe to be used for miner's houses if they want to come. But not many do want to come because the village is too quiet. Some older people in the village do not want miners to come, because they think the place will be a lot noisier, and some younger people do not want to live near miners. But some others think it would be a good idea if the village was bigger. There would be more shops, more entertainment, and better transport. Perhaps the railway station would be re-opened.
